para.text: So far, we have defined the K parameter but it isn't applied to any data set. In the MODFLOW models, there were options to apply horizontal and vertical anisotropy. SUTRA does not have anisotropy options so we will apply the K parameter to both the maximum hydraulic conductivity and minimum hydraulic conductivity data sets.
To apply it to the Kx data set, select
and select the Maximum_Hydraulic_Conductivity and Minimum_Hydraulic_Conductivity data sets. On the PEST Parameters tab, check the

button. A data sets will be created named "Maximum_Hydraulic_Conductivity_Parameter_Names" and "Minimum_Hydraulic_Conductivity_Parameter_Names." Set the default formula for them to K. If we only wanted the K parameter to apply to part of the mesh, we could do that by assigning the formula for Maximum_Hydraulic_Conductivity_Parameter_Names or Minimum_Hydraulic_Conductivity_Parameter_Names with an object.

para.text: Because the specified heads at the northern and southern ends of the model are major controls on the heads, we would expect that the hydraulic conductivity in the Y direction would be more important than the hydraulic conductivity in the X direction. We have left the Angle_Horizontal data set set to 0 which means that Maximum_Hydraulic_Conductivity corresponds to the hydraulic conductivity in the X direction and Minimum_Hydraulic_Conductivity corresponds to the hydraulic conductivity in the Y direction.
